meanings.definition: An excess of something over what is needed.
meanings.sent1: The surplussed food was donated to the local shelter.
meanings.sent2: The company had a surplussed of inventory after the busy season.
meanings.sent3: The surplussed toys brought joy to the children at the orphanage.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness was a surplussed that overflowed to everyone around her.
meanings.sent5: The surplussed of sunshine made the garden bloom beautifully.

meanings.sent1: The store surplussed their old stock to make room for new products.
meanings.sent2: She surplussed the budget by cutting unnecessary expenses.
meanings.sent3: He surplussed the cupcakes, causing a sweet treat overload at the party.
meanings.sent4: The artist surplussed paint on the canvas, creating a vibrant masterpiece.
meanings.sent5: The chef surplussed the dish with extra herbs, enhancing the flavor.
